article.description: Romain Sato had 12 points and eight rebounds to lead Xavier to a 65-49 win over St. Bonaventure Wednesday night, extending the Bonnies' losing streak to nine.
article.headline: Sato leads businesslike effort
article.linkText: Xavier pastes reeling Bonnies, win seventh straight
article.story: OLEAN, N.Y. (AP) -- Romain Sato had 12 points and eight rebounds to lead Xavier to a 65-49 win over St. Bonaventure Wednesday night, extending the Bonnies' losing streak to nine. Lionel Chalmers had 13 points for the Musketeers, who won their the seventh straight. Justin Doellman added 12 points and Anthony Myles 10. The game was tied 29-29 at halftime after St. Bonaventure's Maurice Young hit a 3-pointer with 44 seconds left in the first half. But, Xavier (17-9, 8-5 Atlantic 10) went on a 24-4 run, capped by four 3s by four different players, to begin the second half. Young led St. Bonaventure (6-18, 2-11) with 16 points. The Bonnies lost leading rebounder Ahmad Smith in the first minute in the game when he strained his hip.
